ygData.subject: URL Canonicalization regex to strip sessionIds
ygData.msgSnippet: hi, I encountered a site (http://joann.com) that generates sessionIds that don t get stripped by the URL Canonicalization rules that come in the default

Subject: URL Canonicalization regex to strip sessionIds

hi,

I encountered a site (http://joann.com) that generates sessionIds 
that don't get stripped by the URL Canonicalization rules that come 
in the default Heritrix installation.  The sessioned URLs look like 
this:

http://joann.com/catalog.jhtml;$sessionid$JKOFFNYAAKUTIP4SY5NBHOR50LD
3OEPO?CATID=96029

I tried several variants at creating a RegexRule for stripping out 
these sessionIds, based on the documentation in section 6.2.1 of the 
Heritrix user manual, but based on the log output when I uncommented 
the heritrix.properties org.archive.crawler.url.Canonicalizer line, 
I can see my regex isn't working.  The last regex I tried was:

"^(.+)(?:(?:\$sessionid\$)" + "(.+))$"

I must confess, I didn't understand  the reason for having two 
levels of non-capturing group escaping in this regex, nor did I 
understand why this regex needed to use string concatenation.  (I 
based the regex on the example in the manual.)  I also tried it with 
just 1 level of non-capturing group escaping and without the string 
concatenation, i.e.:

"^(.+)(?:\$sessionid\$.+)$"

which also didn't work.

If anyone has suggestions, I'd appreciate some help.

thanks,

Mike Schwartz
Aptas, Inc.
